QAPair.Question: What is (are) Retrosternal thyroid surgery ?
QAPair.Answer: The thyroid gland is normally located at the front of the neck. A retrosternal thyroid refers to the abnormal location of all or part of the thyroid gland below the breastbone (sternum).

QAPair.Question: Who is at risk for Retrosternal thyroid surgery? ?
What is the outlook for Retrosternal thyroid surgery ?
QAPair.Answer: Outcome of this surgery is usually excellent. Most people need to take thyroid hormone pills (thyroid hormone replacement) for the rest of their lives when the whole gland is removed.
